DriveVaultUser.title: DriveVaultUser
DriveVaultUser.description: Represents a user of the DriveVault application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the DriveVaultUser entity.

googleDriveAccountId.description: Reference to the GoogleDriveAccount connected to this user. (Relationship: DriveVaultUser 1:1 GoogleDriveAccount)

GoogleDriveAccount.title: GoogleDriveAccount
GoogleDriveAccount.description: Represents a connected Google Drive account.

id.description: Unique identifier for the GoogleDriveAccount entity.

userId.description: Reference to the DriveVaultUser who owns this account. (Relationship: DriveVaultUser 1:1 GoogleDriveAccount)

accessToken.description: Access token for the Google Drive account.

refreshToken.description: Refresh token for the Google Drive account.

email.description: The email address associated with the Google Drive account.

BackupLog.title: BackupLog
BackupLog.description: Represents a log entry for a backup activity.

id.description: Unique identifier for the BackupLog entity.

userId.description: Reference to the DriveVaultUser who initiated the backup. (Relationship: DriveVaultUser 1:N BackupLog)

startTime.description: Timestamp indicating when the backup started.

endTime.description: Timestamp indicating when the backup finished.

message.description: Any relevant message or error associated with the backup.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore data structure is designed to ensure secure and scalable data management for the DriveVault application. The core principle is Authorization Independence, achieved through denormalization, which avoids complex `get()` calls in security rules and enables atomic operations. We also enforce structural segregation and standardized access modeling for clarity and consistency.

*   **DriveVaultUser (Private Data):** Stores user-specific data. The structure follows path-based ownership under `/users/{userId}/drivevault_user`. This ensures that each user can only access their own data. This enables atomic operations and simplifies security rules.
*   **GoogleDriveAccount (Private Data):**  Stores the connected Google Drive account details for a user. This structure follows path-based ownership under `/users/{userId}/google_drive_account`. This ensures that each user can only access their own Google Drive account details. This enables atomic operations and simplifies security rules.
*   **BackupLog (Private Data):** Stores backup logs for each user. The structure follows path-based ownership under `/users/{userId}/backup_logs/{backupLogId}`. This isolates backup logs to their respective users and enforces clear ownership. This also enables atomic operations and simplifies security rules.

This structure supports required QAPs:

*   **Secure List Operations:** Path-based ownership ensures that listing documents under `/users/{userId}/...` only returns data accessible to the authenticated user, preventing unauthorized data exposure.
